intro: Leucopsis gnaphalioides, commonly known as the silverleaf groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage, which gives it its common name, and its small, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other similar plants. Leucopsis gnaphalioides is often found in the Western and Eastern Cape provinces of South Africa.
